result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeff A McGowan

records.addlTxt:
1:27 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jeff A McGowan in court.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington in court for Jeff A McGowan.
Covers 21CM232, 22CM33 and 22CM35
Attorney Harrington recites agreement. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

21CM232
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - Guilty plea entered.
Count 4 - State moves to amend to county ordinance possession of THC 9.19. Court grants amendment. Guilty plea entered.
Count 5 - Guilty plea entered.

22CM33 - DRI

22CM35 - DRI

Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty. State relates. Attorney Harrington relates. Defendant relates. Court relates. State relates. Attorney Harrington relates. Court relates and orders:

Count 4:
$267.50 forfeiture - 60 DTP

Count 5:
5 days jail - Work release and Huber granted - Good time granted - Credit for 4 days
Court costs including DNA surcharge - 60 DTP
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.

Count 3:
SW - 1 year Probation - Must report to Probation by 4:00 PM today
Must maintain absolute sobriety.
May not go onto any premises where alcohol is sold except for employment purposes.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court costs including DNA surcharge - 60 DTP to Clerk of Court.
Order for DNA given to defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.
Plea hearing on June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:21 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeff A McGowan appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Joseph Harrington for Jeff A McGowan appeared in court.
Covers 22CM33 and 22CM35
Reading of Complaints waived.  Not guilty pleas entered to both cases.  Defendant will appear in person for next date.
Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Attorney fees. Andrew Harrington appointed. $25.00 per month starting 03/25/2022.

THIS BOND COVERS BOTH CASES 22CM33 AND 22CM35

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Defendant must not go onto the premises of The Webb Bar in Cameron WI.

1:04 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jeff A McGowan appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew T Knaak for Jeff A McGowan appeared by video. 

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CM33 AND 22CM35

Court appoints Attorney Andrew Harrington to these cases; to be repaid as other case(s).
AIA set; appear in person.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

(Bond and MS scanned to jail)
